org.apache.juneau.rest

Class RestCallHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.rest.RestCallHandler

  • public class RestCallHandler
extends Object
    Class that handles the basic lifecycle of an HTTP REST call.

    Subclasses can override these methods to tailor how HTTP REST calls are handled. Subclasses MUST implement a public constructor that takes in a RestContext object.

    RestCallHandlers are associated with servlets/resources in one of the following ways:

    • The @RestResource.callHandler() annotation.
    • The RestConfig.setCallHandler(Class) method.

    • Method Detail

      • createRequest

        protected RestRequest createRequest(HttpServletRequest req)
                             throws ServletException
        Creates a RestRequest object based on the specified incoming HttpServletRequest object.

        Subclasses may choose to override this method to provide a specialized request object.

        Parameters:
        req - The request object from the service(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method.
        Returns:
        The wrapped request object.
        Throws:
        ServletException - If any errors occur trying to interpret the request.

      • createResponse

        protected RestResponse createResponse(RestRequest req,
                                      HttpServletResponse res)
                               throws ServletException
        Creates a RestResponse object based on the specified incoming HttpServletResponse object and the request returned by createRequest(HttpServletRequest).

        Subclasses may choose to override this method to provide a specialized response object.

        Parameters:
        req - The request object returned by createRequest(HttpServletRequest).
        res - The response object from the service(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method.
        Returns:
        The wrapped response object.
        Throws:
        ServletException - If any errors occur trying to interpret the request or response.

      • service

        protected void service(HttpServletRequest r1,
                       HttpServletResponse r2)
                throws ServletException,
                       IOException
        The main service method.

        Subclasses can optionally override this method if they want to tailor the behavior of requests.

        Parameters:
        r1 - The incoming HTTP servlet request object.
        r2 - The incoming HTTP servlet response object.
        Throws:
        ServletException
        IOException

      • handleResponse

        protected void handleResponse(RestRequest req,
                              RestResponse res,
                              Object output)
                       throws IOException,
                              RestException
        The main method for serializing POJOs passed in through the RestResponse.setOutput(Object) method or returned by the Java method.

        Subclasses may override this method if they wish to modify the way the output is rendered or support other output formats.

        The default implementation simply iterates through the response handlers on this resource looking for the first one whose ResponseHandler.handle(RestRequest, RestResponse, Object) method returns true.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        output - The output to serialize in the response.
        Throws:
        IOException
        RestException

      • handleNotFound

        protected void handleNotFound(int rc,
                              RestRequest req,
                              RestResponse res)
                       throws Exception
        Handle the case where a matching method was not found.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide a 2nd-chance for specifying a response. The default implementation will simply throw an exception with an appropriate message.

        Parameters:
        rc - The HTTP response code.
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • handleError

        protected void handleError(HttpServletRequest req,
                           HttpServletResponse res,
                           RestException e)
                    throws IOException
        Method for handling response errors.

        The default implementation logs the error and calls renderError(HttpServletRequest,HttpServletResponse,RestException).

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own custom error response handling.

        Parameters:
        req - The servlet request.
        res - The servlet response.
        e - The exception that occurred.
        Throws:
        IOException - Can be thrown if a problem occurred trying to write to the output stream.

      • renderError

        protected void renderError(HttpServletRequest req,
                           HttpServletResponse res,
                           RestException e)
                    throws IOException
        Method for rendering response errors.

        The default implementation renders a plain text English message, optionally with a stack trace if RestContext.REST_renderResponseStackTraces is enabled.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own custom error response handling.

        Parameters:
        req - The servlet request.
        res - The servlet response.
        e - The exception that occurred.
        Throws:
        IOException - Can be thrown if a problem occurred trying to write to the output stream.

      • onSuccess

        protected void onSuccess(RestRequest req,
                         RestResponse res,
                         long time)
        Callback method for listening for successful completion of requests.

        Subclasses can override this method for gathering performance statistics.

        The default implementation does nothing.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        time - The time in milliseconds it took to process the request.

      • onPreCall

        protected void onPreCall(RestRequest req)
                  throws RestException
        Callback method that gets invoked right before the REST Java method is invoked.

        Subclasses can override this method to override request headers or set request-duration properties before the Java method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP servlet request object.
        Throws:
        RestException - If any error occurs.

      • onPostCall

        protected void onPostCall(RestRequest req,
                          RestResponse res)
                   throws RestException
        Callback method that gets invoked right after the REST Java method is invoked, but before the serializer is invoked.

        Subclasses can override this method to override request and response headers, or set/override properties used by the serializer.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP servlet request object.
        res - The HTTP servlet response object.
        Throws:
        RestException - If any error occurs.

      • getSessionObjects

        public Map<String,Object> getSessionObjects(RestRequest req)
        Returns the session objects for the specified request.

        The default implementation simply returns a single map containing {'req':req}.

        Parameters:
        req - The REST request.
        Returns:
        The session objects for that request.
